chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Oscar Anthony Artiga in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Oscar Anthony Artiga.  Assistant District Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin.
Projected guilty plea has been adjourned in Br 45 at defense request.  mn
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-20-2022, Filed.

Defendant Oscar Anthony Artiga in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Oscar Anthony Artiga.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided update to the court, regarding negotiations with the State. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 45. Court advised Defendant to continue compliance with JusticePoint. Plea hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 9:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated 09-02-2022; received and filed.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF

Defendant Oscar Anthony Artiga in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calendared for plea hearing however, Defense requests additional time for continued negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Oscar Anthony Artiga in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Oscar Anthony Artiga appeared by video means with Attorney.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Oscar Anthony Artiga in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Oscar Anthony Artiga appeared by video means with Attorney.  Status held and adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JPS report

Defendant Oscar Anthony Artiga and Attorney Thomas Harris appear by video.   Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing.  Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court held colloquy with defendant.  Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bond over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Br.34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 8:30am.
JPS report

Defendant Oscar Anthony Artiga in court by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Defendant Oscar Anthony Artiga in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Oscar Anthony Artiga in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Oscar Anthony Artiga appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
